Package eu.datacrop.maize.model_repository.mongodb.repositories

Interface VendorRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Vendor,String>, org.springframework.data.mongodb.repository.MongoRepository<Vendor,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Vendor,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Vendor>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Vendor,String>
@Repository @Profile("devmongo") public interface VendorRepository extends org.springframework.data.mongodb.repository.MongoRepository<Vendor,String>
This class is the bridge between MongoDb and the Spring Framework application as far as Vendor transactions are concerned.
Since:
version 0.4.0
Author:
Angela-Maria Despotopoulou [Athens, Greece]

    findAll(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
    This method retrieves all Vendors ever persisted on the database.

  • Method Details

    • findFirstByName

      Vendor findFirstByName(String name)
      This method retrieves a Vendor given its human-readable name as identifier. Business-wise the name is unique but the attribute is not technically unique. Therefore, only the first of multiple entities will be returned as a protection measure against database failures.
      Parameters:
      name - A human-readable string that uniquely identifies a persisted Vendor, not null.
      Returns:
      The retrieved Vendor entity.

    • findAll

      org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Vendor> findAll(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      This method retrieves all Vendors ever persisted on the database. Employs pagination.
      Specified by:
      findAll in interface org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Vendor,String>
      Parameters:
      pageable - Information on the pagination configurations, not null.
      Returns:
      The retrieved collection of Vendor entities paginated.
